slide1.p: This is a global integrated circular economy system designed for regions and local territories, combining waste recycling, material production, energy, innovation, logistics, agrosystems, education, and social programs into a single managed ecosystem.

management.h3: We operate based on a dual management model:
management.li1: ZW&US Global Management Company — strategic and operational management;
management.li2: Zero Waste Earth Alliance Foundation — ideology, standards, ethics, global certification.

mission.p: Project Mission — to create a self-sufficient, waste-free, and socially just civilization.
mission.highlight: Fundamental Principle — Zero Waste → Zero Harm → Zero Poverty.

slide2.intro: ZW&US Civilization is a multi-level sustainable development infrastructure that combines Zero Waste technologies, social economy, material production, resource recycling, agrosystems, digital management, and employment programs into a single closed-loop economic model for regions, cities, and villages.

process.h3: We create a full chain of converting waste into resources:
process.item2: Creation of finished construction materials, agro-products, energy, and infrastructure

slide2.conclusion: This is not a separate plant or a local pilot — it is a holistic system capable of forming a new territorial economy and ensuring full employment.

slide3.subtitle: Holding management is built on an international corporate model with clear division of authority and responsibility.

ceo.title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)
ceo.desc: Responsible for strategic holding development, program approval, international partnerships, adherence to strategic standards, and legal responsibility to investors and government structures.

coo.title: Chief Operating Officer (COO)
coo.desc: Manages operational activities, coordinates regions, controls KPI execution, deadlines, budgets, and technological standards.

cfo.title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
cfo.desc: Forms and controls the budget, financial reporting, investment programs, ensures transparency of financial flows and return on investment.

cto.title: Chief Technical Officer (CTO)
cto.desc: Responsible for technological architecture, equipment, RPC lines, MRF centers, logistics, and production process standards.

clo.title: Chief Legal Officer (CLO)
clo.desc: Handles permits, licenses, land issues, legal protection, and regulatory compliance.

cso.title: Chief Sustainability Officer (CSO)
cso.desc: Responsible for environmental safety, climatic parameters, compliance with Zero Waste Civilization standards.

architect.title: Chief Architect / Chief Systems Engineer
architect.desc: Creates the architecture of the entire ecosystem, standardizes territorial solutions, interaction of clusters and material flows.

ai.title: Director of AI & Digital Platform
ai.desc: Creates the ZW&US digital management platform, ensures analytics, monitoring, and ERP management.

slide3.footer: The team is formed on a modular principle and is capable of launching and managing projects from local systems to planetary scale.

slide4.subtitle: Level 2 of the system consists of six functional clusters that ensure the full cycle of the Zero Waste economy:

a.title: Recycling & MRF Infrastructure
a.desc: Collection, sorting, waste preparation, visual quality control of raw materials, extraction of secondary materials, and RDF production.

b.title: RPC Manufacturing
b.desc: Production of construction RPC composites from RDF and polymer components, manufacturing of plates, panels, beams, load-bearing structures.

c.title: Biomass & Agro Systems
c.desc: Restoration of food and construction forests across the Earth, Restoration of all planetary water systems.

d.title: Logistics & Operations
d.desc: Logistics of RDF and finished products, transport flows, warehousing, distribution, facility maintenance.

e.title: R&D and Engineering
e.desc: Development of new technologies, improvement of composites, increasing equipment efficiency, standardization of lines.

f.title: Education & Social Systems
f.desc: Colleges, personnel training programs, social employment programs, community support, emergency services.

slide4.footer: These clusters work as a single organism, forming a circular economy.

slide5.subtitle: Level 3 is the regional management and implementation infrastructure, including:

list.li2: Plant for mass production of RPC equipment, equipment for seedling production, construction material production
list.li3: Group of construction companies for infrastructure, buildings, and furniture production
list.li5: Training Centers and Zero Waste Colleges

slide5.highlight: Regional systems ensure CE standards implementation, manage local NovaTerra units, and form the territory's economic stability.

slide6.subtitle: Level 4 is the basic cell of ZW&US civilization:

mrf.title: MRF Center
mrf.desc: Waste sorting, preparation, and temporary storage of raw materials

school.title: Zero Waste School
school.desc: Local education and employment for the entire local population

restore.title: Restoration Center
restore.desc: Rivers, lakes, food and construction forests, food production

slide6.highlight: One local ZW&US is capable of fully sustaining 200,000 residents.

card1.p: ZW&US is not a factory or an industry. It is a full ecosystem of production, recycling, energy, education, and social economy.
card1.small: Each element reinforces the other: recycling → production → agrosystem → education.

card3.p: Waste is not destroyed — it is converted into resources.
card3.steps: Collection → Sorting → RPC → Construction → Agrosystem → Products

card5.p: The model is standardized for any territory: city, municipality, industrial zone, agro-zone, region.
card5.highlight: Program for 49,000 territories on the planet.

main.h3: The world faces a critical waste situation
main.p: The linear economy "take → make → waste" has stopped working.

eco.p: Waste is not recycled, land is polluted, landfills are growing.

econ.p: Regions lose billions of dollars due to burning RDF and resource loss.

slide8.solution: ZW&US solves this problem through a system where waste becomes resources, and recycling becomes the basis of the regional economy.

list.li1: Network of cultural and educational centers

slide9.highlight: This is a single production-social cycle capable of ensuring territory development without waste and restoring the entire natural ecosystem.

step4.desc: Training of RPC, MRF, logistics operators.

step6.desc: Launch of multiple MRFs, capacity increase.

clo.p: Legal protection, permits, compliance with standards.

slide11.highlight: Each executive makes decisions within their area of responsibility.
